intro: Arabis pulchra var. munciensis, commonly known as the Muncie beauty, is a perennial flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 inches and produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers in early spring. Its foliage consists of basal rosettes of lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
